thread.title: Tom Watson Appears To Perform A Celebratory Dab After Jeremy Corbyn's PMQs Zinger
thread.title_full: Tom Watson Appears To Perform A Celebratory Dab After Jeremy Corbyn's PMQs Zinger

author: Aubrey Allegretti
title: Tom Watson Appears To Perform A Celebratory Dab After Jeremy Corbyn's PMQs Zinger
text:
Tom Watson Appears To Perform A Celebratory Dab After Jeremy Corbyn's PMQs Zinger 'I may have inadvertently done one.' 22/02/2017 12:53 | Updated 12 minutes ago Aubrey Allegretti Politics Reporter, HuffPost UK Christopher Furlong via Getty Images Surely a first for the House of Commons? 
Move over, Ed Balls - Labour has a new Lord of the Dance. 
Tom Watson appeared on Wednesday to perform a celebratory ‘dab’ after Jeremy Corbyn stung Theresa May with a question on the NHS. 
The pair had been sparring at Prime Minister’s Questions when Corbyn asked: 
“It seems to me that some Members don’t want to be concerned about the fact that there are 1.2 million elderly people not getting the care that they need. 
“The legacy of her government will be blighting our NHS for decades - fewer hospitals, fewer A&E depts, fewer nurses, and fewer people getting the care they need. 
“We need a government that puts the NHS first and will invest in our NHS.” 
As Corbyn sat down, a wide camera-shot appeared to show Watson doing the dab to hammer home Corbyn’s fierce barb. Big question: Did @tom_watson dab at the end of Jeremy Corbyn's PMQs? pic.twitter.com/i3VRVGKRFo — Jim Waterson (@jimwaterson) February 22, 2017 
Twitter immediately went into overdrive, with speculation about whether the move was ‘unparliamentary’. 
Tom Watson can't resist a cheeky dab after Jeremy Corbyn's blast at Theresa May on the NHS #PMQs pic.twitter.com/TFtIe6FKlf — Asa Bennett (@asabenn) February 22, 2017 I hope Tom Watson is held in contempt of Parliament for this extremely out of order dab pic.twitter.com/MV9e739lVs — Ned Donovan (@Ned_Donovan) February 22, 2017 
Answering the flurry of speculation about his dancing, Watson told HuffPost UK after PMQs: Did I do a dab? I’ve been doing them with my kids in the holidays so I may have inadvertently done one 
The Press Association describes the ‘dab’ as “a gesture which involves raising one arm and hiding your face as if you are about to sneeze”. More:
